text.text: Balham’s got a rep for being one of South West London’s yuppy villages where wannabe Clapham-ites and Australians collide. It might not be party central but it’s where we go if we’re after a good Georgian pastry and a proper Aussie brunch. Time to have it large Balham baby.
Best for... kicking back on Chesterfields

tip.text:
They might not plays bowls here anymore, but the club house hasn't lost one bit of its musty, stiff upper lip charm. Bowls trophies, scoreboards and old furniture are dotted all over this massive wood-panelled pub that feels like it's straight out the 1940s.

The gastropub menu here is definitely slicker than you'd expect, with dishes like Pan-Fried Salmon Nicoise, and they have some good beers on tap too. Quiz nights (Tuesday at 8pm) and live comedy here make great use of this old timey space.

text.text: They might not plays bowls here anymore, but the club house hasn't lost one bit of its musty, stiff upper lip charm. Bowls trophies, scoreboards and old furniture are dotted all over this massive wood-panelled pub that feels like it's straight out the 1940s. The gastropub menu here is definitely slicker than you'd expect, with dishes like Pan-Fried Salmon Nicoise, and they have some good beers on tap too.
Best for... watching Balham’s elite sipping coffee

If you need to momentarily escape the city mayhem, come along and kick back at this incredibly slow-paced Australian café. It's quickly become a real hot spot in Balham, with queues on the weekend for their brunch offerings. With a green eating etiquette, this eco-friendly eatery strictly sources its products from independent and local family-owned suppliers around London and caters for all sorts. It also does a spot of dinner too on the weekends.
Best for... food from the boot

tip.text:
It doesn't matter if you can't pronounce the name of this restaurant...the important thing is that you actually visit. Ciullõsteria has won loyal customers all over London who all say this is one of the best Italians in the city. Once you try their homemade pasta in dishes like Ravioli filled with Wild Mushrooms and Fresh Pesto, you're not going to argue.

The food is one thing, but the welcome you receive here is a far cry from the sullen Nando's norm. Once you're in here, they're going to look after you well.

text.text: It doesn't matter if you can't pronounce the name of this restaurant, the important thing is that you actually visit. Ciullõsteria has won loyal customers all over London for being one of the top Italians about. Once you try their homemade pasta in dishes like Ravioli filled with Wild Mushrooms and Fresh Pesto, you're not going to argue. The food is one thing, but the welcome you receive here is a far cry from the sullen Nando's norm.
Best for... a performance and a pint

tip.text:
Standard boozer from the outside, Balham bantz on the inside - we have a soft spot for The Bedford. It's a bit of a beast, spread over three floors, with five bars, live music four nights a week, a big globe theatre out back, dance classes, cabaret on the weekends... if you can't find something here that tickles your fancy then you're a picky one, aren't you?

Don't bother with the food here and please excuse the Wetherspoons interiors, but do come for fair prices, performance and general japes.

text.text: Standard boozer looks from the outside, Balham bantz on the inside - we have a soft spot for The Bedford. It's a bit of a beast, spread over three floors, with five bars, live music four nights a week, a big globe theatre out back, dance classes, cabaret on the weekends... if you can't find something here that tickles your fancy then you're a picky one, aren't you? Don't bother with the food here and please excuse the Wetherspoons interiors, but do come for fair prices, performance and general japes.

tip.text:
Out on a bit of a limb in Balham? Lost and Found will put you back on track with their mega menu of cocktails. Go for something crazy like the Daddy's Hip Flask (Cognac with Chartreuse Green liqueur. Strong, sweetened with home made tobacco syrup) served in an actual hip flask or ask the staff to put together whatever you fancy.

This bar isn't going to blow your socks off but it's vibing throughout the week and their happy hour is one of the most generous around - 2-4-1 on cocktails every evening between 5 and 9 - can't argue with that.

text.text: This bar isn't going to blow your socks off but it's vibing throughout the week and their happy hour is one of the most generous around: 2-4-1 on cocktails every evening between 5 and 9. Can't argue with that. Go for something like the Daddy's Hip Flask (Cognac with Chartreuse Green liqueur sweetened with home made tobacco syrup) served in an actual hip flask or ask the staff to put together whatever you fancy. You're the boss - never forget that.
Best for... a taste of Georgia

tip.text:
The Georgians really know how to make you feel welcome...and how to put on a massive spread. All through the day, Georgian goodies with impossible to pronounce names are served up here - Glekhuri Casserole in the morning, Borshch at lunchtime, Chaqapul Lamb Stew in the evenings... all in hefty portions.

What we love most here is stopping in for Georgian cake - the quaint layout of the place with its mismatched crockery, and good chat from the staff make this properly different from the Antipodean norm around Balham.

text.text: The Georgians really know how to make you feel welcome...and how to put on a massive spread. All through the day, Georgian goodies with impossible to pronounce names are served up here - Glekhuri Casserole in the morning, Borshch at lunchtime, Chaqapul Lamb Stew in the evenings... all in hefty portions. The quaint layout of the place, with its mismatched crockery and good chat from the staff, make this properly different from the Antipodean norm around Balham.
Best for... a slap-up dinner out

tip.text:
Sure, the inside could do with a bit of luvin’ but don't let this put you off - just wait til you try the grub. Start with the homemade sourdough and sea salt butter with a steamy bowl of devilled clams.

Go for a meaty main; the supplier in the Lake District delivers some darn juicy flesh. 99% of their produce is British and with their own specialist forager to handpick the leafiest fare straight from the forests, it all packs plenty of flavour and a healthy crunch. Pud is positively out of this world. The dark chocolate and salted caramel pot puts the guys at Gu to shame. And if that ain't enough, don’t panic, they bring chocolate truffles with the bill… Gutsy, unpretentious and goddamn delicious.

text.text: Gutsy, unpretentious and goddamn delicious is how we'd describe this place. Sure, the inside could do with a bit of luvin’ but don't let that put you off - just wait 'til you try the grub. Go for a meaty main; the supplier in the Lake District delivers some darn juicy flesh. 99% of their produce is British and with their own specialist forager to handpick the leafiest fare straight from the forests, it all packs plenty of flavour and a healthy crunch. Slightly on the expensive side but well worth it.

tip.text:
Between trying their very best to smash us at cricket and rugby, the Aussies are determined to bring their style of coffee and brunch to London. And you know what? Fair play, because Brickwood in Balham is belting.

It feels like a mental little rough-and-ready shack inside, but the brunch goodies the kitchen pumps out are bang on, like wild mushrooms & poached egg with basil pesto, balsamic & tarragon on sourdough. You might have to queue for a table, but they'll whip up a coffee while you're waiting that's criminally good.

text.text: We did mention that Balham had a strong antipodean flavour to it, and here's another real nice spot. It feels like a mental little rough-and-ready shack inside, but the brunch goodies the kitchen pumps out are bang on, like Wild Mushrooms & Poached Egg w/ Basil Pesto, Balsamic & Tarragon on Sourdough. You might have to queue for a table, but they'll whip up a coffee while you're waiting that'll leave you in a frenzy.
